content: give me list of steps on how can i get my repo sent to a branch on github using linux cli

Sure! Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to send your repository to a branch on GitHub using the Linux command-line interface (CLI)
  1. Open your terminal: 🖥️
    Launch your terminal application on your Linux machine.
  2. Navigate to your repository: 📂
    Use the cd command to change directories to your project folder. For example:
    cd /path/to/your/repo
  3. Check your current branch: 🔍
    Execute the following command to see which branch you are currently on:
    git branch
  4. Create a new branch (if needed): 🏗️
    If you want to create a new branch, use:
    git checkout -b your-branch-name
  5. Add changes to the staging area: 📝
    Add your changes before committing:
    git add .
    (This adds all changes; specify files if needed.)
  6. Commit your changes: 💾
    Now commit your changes with a descriptive message:
    git commit -m "Your commit message here"
  7. Push your changes to GitHub: 🚀
    Use the following command to push your changes to the specified branch:
    git push origin your-branch-name
  8. Verify the branch on GitHub: 🌐
    Go to your GitHub repository page and check that the changes are reflected in the correct branch.

If you need to switch branches, you can use the command:
git checkout another-branch-name

Happy coding! 🎉
